===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=みこ}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=みこ}}. Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=みこ|神|tr1=mi|t1=spirit, god|子|tr2=ko|t2=child}}, as suggested by the alternative spelling {{m|ja|神子}}.

Formerly spelled as {{m|ja|巫}} on its own.<ref name="SMK5">{{R:Shinmeikai5}}</ref>  The modern kanji spelling {{lang|ja|巫女}} appears to be [[ateji]], as an example of {{m|ja|熟字訓|tr=jukujikun}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|みこ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5|acc2=0|acc2_ref=DJR,SMK5}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{m|ja|神子}}, {{m|ja|神巫}} {{qualifier|rare}}, {{m|ja|巫}} {{qualifier|obsolete}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|みこ}}

# An [[unmarried]] woman who [[serve]]s at a [[Shintō]] [[shrine]], helping to receive visitors and performing {{m|ja|神楽|tr=kagura}} dances at ceremonies, among other responsibilities.
# An [[unmarried]] woman who serves a [[deity]] as a [[medium]] to [[convey]] [[oracle]]s.

=====Usage notes=====
Using the alternate spelling {{l|ja|神子}}, a ''miko'' could be of either gender, but unmarried young women are by far the most common.

* {{sense|shrine dancer}}
** {{ja-r|舞姫|まいひめ}}

** {{ja-r|巫子|いちこ}}, {{ja-r|巫子|いたこ}}
** {{ja-r|神楽女|かぐらめ}}
* {{sense|oracle}}
** {{ja-r|巫|かんなぎ}}, {{ja-r|覡|かんなぎ}}
** {{ja-r|巫子|いちこ}}, {{ja-r|巫子|いたこ}}
** {{ja-r|口寄せ|くちよせ}}
